problem_summary_simple: Select items to maximize total value, subject to limits on the number of items and items per label.
problem_summary_technical: Pairs values with labels, sorts them by value descending, and greedily picks items, respecting `numWanted` and `useLimit` for each label using a frequency map.
key_insights: A greedy approach works because we want to maximize the sum, so picking the highest value items first is optimal.
Sorting items by value in descending order is key to the greedy strategy.
A hashmap is used to keep track of the count of items selected for each label to enforce the `useLimit` constraint.
